section.name: ENSEMBLE PERFORMANCE: PENN CHAMBER MUSIC SOC

comments:
This course is an option for students in the Penn Chamber Music Society, giving members of this extracurricular ensemble the chance to receive one credit for two semesters of participation.

The students agreed that chamber was a “great experience,” and one student expanded on this by saying, “One of my favorite things about Penn is that I get to take this course for credit.” 

The course has multiple instructors. One student described Professor Yang as one who “has the ability to inspire us and to play musically.” Students agreed that he helped them to improve as musicians. Instructor Beverly Shine was described by students as “fantastic.” He “consistently provided clear musical advice.” Students viewed Professor Adela as nice but sometimes “too nice” and shy with giving criticism that could improve the students musically.
